project.name: TradeTheDay Astro
project.description: Trading education and broker review website built with Astro

architecture.styling: External CSS with design system tokens

css.enforcement: ALL styles MUST be in external CSS files
css.structure: Modular CSS architecture with design system tokens
css.imports: Use Astro CSS import syntax: import './styles/file.css'
css.violations: Any inline style= attribute is FORBIDDEN
css.exceptions: Only dynamic JavaScript-calculated values allowed inline

javascript.policy: EXTERNAL FILES ONLY - NO INLINE SCRIPTS
javascript.enforcement: ALL JavaScript MUST be in external files
javascript.violations: Any <script> tag with inline code is FORBIDDEN
javascript.exceptions: Only JSON-LD structured data allowed inline

html.policy: SEMANTIC MARKUP WITH DESIGN SYSTEM CLASSES
html.enforcement: Use standardized class names from design system
html.accessibility: ARIA attributes and semantic elements required

layout.sections: section class with section-light, section-dark, section-hero variants
layout.containers: container class for max-width and centering
layout.spacing: text-center, mb-lg, mt-xl, etc. utility classes

components.cards: Use Card.astro component with standardized props
components.chips: ALWAYS use Chip component with variant='badge' size='sm' for consistent styling

componentLibrary.required: Import all necessary components in frontmatter

standardComponents.Chip: Small status/category indicators - MUST use variant='badge' size='sm'

componentLibrary.props: Use TypeScript interfaces for component props

performanceOptimization.css: External files enable browser caching and parallel loading
performanceOptimization.js: Defer non-critical JavaScript with is:inline directive

newPages: 2. Import required external CSS file first
3. Import necessary components from component library
cssModification: 1. NEVER add inline styles to any element
2. Create or modify external CSS files in /src/styles/
3. Use CSS custom properties for consistency
4. Follow BEM methodology for class naming
5. Ensure responsive design with mobile-first approach
componentUsage: 1. Always check existing components before creating new ones
2. Use component props for data passing

codestandards.imports: Organize imports: CSS first, then components, then utilities
codestandards.naming: Use kebab-case for CSS classes, PascalCase for components
codestandards.comments: Document complex logic and component usage
codestandards.seo: Include proper meta tags and structured data

beforeCommit: 1. Run development server and test all pages
2. Verify zero inline styles across all files
qualityAssurance.testing: Manual testing required for all changes

commonPatterns.pageStructure: Hero â†’ Breadcrumb â†’ Navigation â†’ Content Sections â†’ CTA
commonPatterns.typography: Consistent heading hierarchy with design system classes
commonPatterns.spacing: Use design system spacing utilities consistently

troubleshooting.stylingIssues: Check external CSS import and file structure
troubleshooting.componentErrors: Verify component imports and prop interfaces
troubleshooting.buildFailures: Check for inline styles or invalid HTML structure
troubleshooting.performanceIssues: Review CSS/JS file organization and loading

chipStandardization.enforcement: ZERO TOLERANCE - ALL CHIPS MUST USE STANDARDIZED FORMAT
chipStandardization.cssRule: Only use minimal spacing CSS like .hero-content .chip { margin-bottom: var(--space-lg); }

aiInstructions.primaryRule: NEVER CREATE INLINE STYLES - ALWAYS USE EXTERNAL CSS
aiInstructions.chipRule: ALWAYS use Chip component with variant='badge' size='sm' format
aiInstructions.approach: Follow the gold standard reference page for all styling decisions
aiInstructions.workflow: Analyze existing patterns before creating new components
aiInstructions.consistency: Maintain uniform typography, spacing, and component usage
aiInstructions.performance: Prioritize external CSS/JS for optimal loading and caching
